website_summaries.verdict: A versatile panel that can be used alone or as part of a solar panel array, that offers good, if variable, wattage output for its price point.
pros: Can be combined with multiple panels to increase solar wattage
Owners like being able to configure solar array setups using individual panels
Great wattage output for the price
cons: Solar wattage can be quite variable from panel to panel
No mounting brackets or lead wires included, frustrating a few owners

customer_reviews.title: My Apartment Solar Set Up
customer_reviews.text: I get about a 150 watts of output from the two panels on my scrap wood stands sitting on my apartment balcony facing South/ SouthWest form about 10:00 am to 3:00 pm on a sunny day
customer_reviews.author: Shade Tree Solar

customer_reviews.title: Great solar panel maybe not so great.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two for my sailboat. These are great. Very solid build with great frame. Arrived in perfect condition, not a scratch on the panel or the frame. On the way to Bahamas for three months and will update when return. Will likely purchase two more. In use for about a month on my boat. Sitting in southern Florida with two panels perpendicular to the sun on a clear day. Using MC4 Y branch connectors for parallel feed to 10ft of 10AWG cable to 99% efficient controller. Result is 7.9 amps/13.2v (about 104 watts). What gives?? Why not approaching max of 8 amps? Very disappointed in this low output performance. Tempted to return just because output is misstated
customer_reviews.author: reo time

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size!
customer_reviews.text: I need the extra 1.5 inch of space to get 2 panels and my maxxair fan on the roof. I added one set at the front and one at the back. To keep the holes in the roof to a minimal, I built a custom roof rack out of unistrut and had it powder coated white to match the van. I ran the wires through the back up camera box on the rear. I hope to have enough room left to install my Coleman roof top A\C.
customer_reviews.author: K West

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should. Top quality.
customer_reviews.text: On short circuit this put out 20.48V and max amps I got with a 5pm sun was 5.48A. Only down side (as with all solar panels) is a little cloud cover will decrease the amps considerably. And covering up one cell reduced output to .8A. Still, this is to be expected and doesn't take away any stars, just info worth sharing.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Received really dirty panels
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised and disappointed at how dirty these panels are. There is glue and all kinds of residue all over them. I had to scrub them with alcohol and window cleaner before I could mount them.
customer_reviews.author: Dbl A

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed. 6-55 watt output. Will update after more tests
customer_reviews.text: So far very disappointed. On an overcast day this is only putting out 12.5v and .5a, so like 6 watts. And on a full sun day 15v and 3.7a, so 55.5 watts. That's absolutely disgraceful. My smaller and older solar panel on the same overcast day was putting out 18-20.1v. In the full sun it puts out 22.8v-24v. Maybe i got a dud. Maybe this unit is just trash idk. I will run some more tests and trouble shoot and i will update this review in the near future when i get some more data. But as of now this is terrible
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Esposito

customer_reviews.title: Compact not so good
customer_reviews.text: The compact 100w was no Good. Very low output and shouty worksmanship. Got the standard 100w which was much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Added a panel
customer_reviews.text: Added 100 watts to my existing Renogy RV solar system for charging my batteries. I went with this smaller panel for roof space. Works fine with the larger 100 watt panels. A watt is a watt no matter the size of the panel.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: 3rd panel works great.
customer_reviews.text: 3rd panel I've installed into our off grid cabin. With 2 panels I was getting between 198 to 212 Watts and 16.5 Amps charge. I'm hooked with the solar bug no question about it. Thats why I bought the 3rd one and have room for 1 more if necessary. I think I could have gotten away with the 2 but like I said solar bug has me now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite of their panels so far.
customer_reviews.text: I bought both this panel and their regular 100 watt panel to use for solar backup power generators. Even though this one is smaller it generates at least as much power in well a more compact design. My Jackery is still only showing around 60 watt maximum charging in 65 degree weather in full sun. For what I need this panel for it is fine and has decent build quality. My house has 8000 watts of Canadian solar panels that for almost 8 years have matched or exceeded their rated output. So I would not put this panel on an entire solar array, but it works fine for what I bought it for. At $100 no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Well built, light weight, and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: Well built, light weight, and easy to handle. Bought the panel to dip my toes into solar by charging my lithium battery pack that has a solar adapter port. Works great takes a few hours to charge the thing back up. Considering building a more complex system to take some of my big appliances off the grid.
customer_reviews.author: Duck Grossberg

customer_reviews.title: Shattered glass during shipment
customer_reviews.text: This review is not concerning the panel power production. I'm confident the panel would perform as specified however, the glass was shattered during shipment. I did note that no styro protective sheet was over the glass as it had been on other brands I've purchased. I'm hoping to be able to get a refund or a new panel. 12/3/19 update. I was unable to get a refund but I found an excellent product to reseal the glass. Lookup "shattered solar panel glass repair" on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: JetMClean

customer_reviews.title: Great panel!  Works reliably.
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this panel flat on the top of a camp trailer. I love it. I don't have to plug in the trailer anymore to maintain the batteries. Connected through a cheap PWM controller and heavy 10 gauge stranded wire, it will put out over 5 amps of charging power during the day in full sun. It also gives me enough capacity to run a TV, DVD and stereo off an inverter for hours at a time without running down my two 12V batteries. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect specs
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4x of these panels and the specs listed on both the Amazon listing and Renogy's website are grossly incorrect. The 4x I received have an extremely low Vmp of 16.0, opposed to the advertised Vmp of 17.9v. This is a problem if you want to match up with other panels you already have, or if you are not wiring these in series and want to use a good MPPT charge controller that requires higher starting voltage. Also to note I contacted Renogy about this and received no reply.
customer_reviews.author: Cian F

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Clean Power Source
customer_reviews.text: Excellent clean power source! This monocrystalline solar panel very efficiently charges my solar power generator. It's well-constructed; and, depending on the time of day and angle of the Sun, I have seen it deliver 39W, 74W and 86Watts. The 39W charge was when the sun was getting ready to set, while the 86W charge was achieved around 1:30 PM here in sunny Florida. It arrived quickly, well-packed and I could not be happier with this product! #AdventureUninterrupted
customer_reviews.author: Tony Pucci

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well
customer_reviews.text: So, the only reason I gave 4 out of 5 starts was because I actually bought five of these at different times. The first one seemed ok, so I bought 4 more. The package looked the same from the outside, but on the inside one was missing their thank you for purchasing paper and two had no corner edge protector to take off. I thought that odd. The only way that could happen is they're returns or factory samples? So, no consistency brought the overall score down. I work in the auto parts manufacturing busyness, this kind of thing would have just been returned.
customer_reviews.author: Nicky G

customer_reviews.title: Worst A grade panel I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a grade A panel The glass is dirty on the backside, there are streaks and a couple of the solar wafers are poor quality. I purchased this panel because I have their suitcase which is immaculate awesome this is an extreme disappointment I would highly recommend not purchasing this panel. It is a waste of money it's worse than a Harbor Freight panel. I would say it is a grade C panel good thing it's just a backup to a backup for me otherwise I have throw it in the trash. Because it's too expensive to Return to Sender
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best solar panel there is.
customer_reviews.text: I use two of these to power my ham radio all day on one small 12 volt auto battery. Very well made and they charge even on a cloudy day. Strong frames and good wiring. I got the controller they also provide and they work fine, in two hours I can recharge my single 12 volt car battery for all day use on my ham radio without turning the panel or adjusting the angle.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Yudysky

customer_reviews.title: a Nice afforable solar panel
customer_reviews.text: I have been messing around with using a solar panel to keep a 12V battery charged for use with a community garden plot water system. This unit coupled with a HQST controller is doing the job so far. Seems to even produce power when covered with frost or a thin film of ice. I like the heavy duty waterproof connectors on the unit.
customer_reviews.author: FGR

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product at Competitive Price
customer_reviews.text: Quality product at competitive price. Planned to use to recharge portable power supplies (RockPals and Wagan) at an off-grid cabin, coupled with the Renogy Wanderer controller. Connected panel to controller with Shierleng 10' MC4 leads (matched 14 AWG), then the Chanzon female DC receptacle (16 AWG with 15A fuse) on the output (battery) side of the controller. Unfortunately, though the panel was producing power, the Renogy Wanderer controller was totally confused--even after carefully making all the right settings, and would not charge the portable power supplies. Had to return both and go with the Rockpals integrated 60W suitcase solar grid and controller.
customer_reviews.author: Etienne

customer_reviews.title: love Renogy products
customer_reviews.text: 100 watts of power, I have one panel and one battery, just enough to recharge it and allow me to at minimum heat water for noodles and coffee, wash up, recharge AA and AAA, run my laptop to listen to music and watch movies. Its the little things....
customer_reviews.author: yukonn

customer_reviews.title: Good solar power
customer_reviews.text: These will be what i use as my main solar array for all individual buildings on my off grid property. I purchased two years ago and finally put them to use. The two panels produce enough wattage and amps in decent sunlight to jump start /charge a battery on a v8 engine. Just be careful because the glass can and will shatter. So if you live in a area prone to hail these will not stand up to that. And it shatters all over when it does. These panels put out as they are rated and build quality is on point. I highly recommend these panels.
customer_reviews.author: Techguy

customer_reviews.title: Outperforms the advertised specs in my case.
customer_reviews.text: Super well made, well packed, all that you expect from an expensive purchase. I bought many things from Renogy to complete this items' purpose. Their customer service was succinct and effective when I called with one question. If I could do it over again I'd have bought all the proper cables right from the start. You need cables, at a minimum to run from this panel to your controller and they should be the original manufacturer's recommended otherwise you'll end up cutting, soldering, taping, and really wishing you hadn't goofed. It's cosmetically best to have the right cables or wait until you get them before starting your install.
customer_reviews.author: Terry  Lynn Harris

customer_reviews.title: Never a Dead Deep Cycly Marine Battery
customer_reviews.text: I use this product while camping with my pull behind RV trailer. I attached with a 30 ft home made cord to the battery and placed the panel to portable foot stool so I could keep it facing the sun as much as possible during the day. The battery powers my water pump, TV, radio, and lights. This 100watt panel typically has the battery fully charged in an hour or less after the sun comes up in the morning and then provides enough power during the day to power everything and keep the battery fully charged. The item is durable enough for how it is being used (being transported and moved around).
customer_reviews.author: Ralf

customer_reviews.title: Love the size
customer_reviews.text: Two of these "slim" 100W solar panels fit inside my cargo carrier when nothing else I found would fit. Because they are fairly lightweight (16 lbs. each, I think) I use them as portable panels for my camper van. I have found that 200W is fine for my needs. Often my lithium battery is completely charged within 5 hours in the sunny southwest winter. I run my DC refrigerator, charge all my electronic stuff, my LED lights, and occasionally my water pump or my fan. I don't have a problem unless there's no sun for three days. Renogy tech support is excellent, always willing to answer questions and give guidance. These are quality solar panels.
customer_reviews.author: CJColorado

customer_reviews.title: Sunshine
customer_reviews.text: Two of these for 200 watts kept my battery charged for the two weeks we were camped in the woods. The morning star charge controller kept it all regulated and safe. Pros, silent no fuel to mess with. Cons; must be in sun.
customer_reviews.author: TwoHawks

customer_reviews.title: Very happy so far
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly impressed so far. As you can see, a temporary setup and it’s doing well. I will buy another or two soon when I am ready to complete my solar shed/garage. This is a quick setup, not sure of the angle and quick test with my Riding mower battery, soon I will put the rest inline
customer_reviews.author: Greg D

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality.  Good Value.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't opened the box on the latest panels that a slightly smaller and slightly more efficient. However, having handle over a thousand PV panels as an assembler of premium solar powered roof ventilators I recognized what appears to be quality workmanship in the panels from Renogy. I've purchased 1400W of 100W panels for my portable solar power system to use after hurricanes at my condo. Generators are not allowed for safety reasons. Most recently I've purchased 400W of 100W Renogy panels for emergency power at our ham radio emergency radio station. Even those panels are seldom deployed I expect they are are comparable to Sunwise or other premium manufacturers. Renogy seems to be a good quality and good value.
customer_reviews.author: Viron E. Payne Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very low watts reading from my solar panels
customer_reviews.text: I finally installed my solar panels and have it up and running. It gives me low wattage reading and sometimes zero. The voltage reading is good. I am not satisfied with the results.
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: This panel is not a 100 watt panel.
customer_reviews.text: This panel is a 75 watt panel not a 100 watt panel. I positioned it full direct over head sun on a clear day and the most I could achieve from this so called "100 watt solar panel' is 73 watts. Just be aware this is common practice in the solar panel industry to rate panels higher than a real-world-operation can achieve. It's a good panel but it is not a 100 watt panel.
customer_reviews.author: BeGreatful

customer_reviews.title: 100W solar.
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these for a 300W system paired with a Renology MPPT charge controller on a 330Ah lead-acid battery bank for a camper van build. I'm not drawing much power from the bank so didn't need maximum efficiency but they work fine and I expect they'll hold up as long as other solar panels would.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Circuit interrupted/ bad pannel
customer_reviews.text: *Update - they sent replacements and are working fine . Out of my latest 100w pannels, one has come with a few defects. Can I send it back for a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Kicks out the power.
customer_reviews.text: Best panels we have used, purchased 2, we have 6 Renogy panels, these 2 and 2 reg. monos with 2 polys ,all less than a year old. Side by side test with silimar wiring in full sun on the ground these compact panels producted 98 watts, standard mono's 90watts and poly 85watts. Smaller, weight is about the same, stores easier, Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: strgrazr

customer_reviews.title: Nice, well-built panels! Good output even in overcast conditions
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these to replace a pair of 120w 'flexible' solar panels on the roof of our vintage camper. The output of the flexible solar panels degraded to nothing in less than two years. I could barely get any output at high noon on the sunniest days. Hooked these up yesterday, and even in very overcast conditions I was getting 20-25w from the pair. Definitely happier now, and I trust Renogy as a respected solar panel manufacturer so I'm sure these will last many years. The only reason I originally went with the flexible panels was to keep a low profile. These are visible now, but at least we have power!
customer_reviews.author: ZE

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition for Camping
customer_reviews.text: We added two of these to our camper. After adding the second one it has increased our power so that we can use the microwave, laptops, fans, recharge phones, etc., whatever we need to do while camping. The only thing they don't do is run the A/C. When we were first installing my husband needed to ask a question about the wiring and he had to call tech support. He wasn't able to get through right away, but when they called him back, he got his answer right away and installation was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: BestsontheroadTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not charging like it should ! Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It’s only charging at 14.4 volts should be 18 to 20 ! Very disappointed in this products . I’d like a refund or a replacement! And I Can prove it’s only outing out 14 that’s a defect !!!
customer_reviews.author: Roni Love

customer_reviews.title: Watch for defective panels
customer_reviews.text: It seems like the pairs are one nice panel and one trashy panel. I don't know where the quality has gone renogy... I used y'all last time I got panels and they were all nice and well built. I have two panels that must have been built on Friday. One has a piece of the corner in front of one of the chips... Very disappointed with renogy quality
customer_reviews.author: Justin Aron

customer_reviews.title: Good product, very poor customer/technical support.
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect any customer or technical support if you have a problem. I've read and heard this in various reviews, and now I've experienced it. Emails? Phone calls? Even with a support ticket number, forget it. Hours on hold. Weeks for email response. Nothing. Customer support is part of the purchase price, and this seems to be Remogy weakness. I haven't purchased or used Battle Born, but I understand they're at least equivalent to Renogy, and they provide excellent, knowledgeable support.
customer_reviews.author: Louis M. White

customer_reviews.title: Only getting 60W max
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 of these 100W mono panels in my array. In full summer sun in the Carolinas, with my batteries depleted to apx 50%, the most I've ever gotten out of this array is 360 Watts. This means I'm only getting an average of 60W per panel. I'm not impressed. Maybe I got counterfeit panels?
customer_reviews.author: hilndr44

customer_reviews.title: Great panels / great value
customer_reviews.text: These panels are great! I didn't notice that they were compact when I ordered them so I needed to adjust my mounts which I had setup for the previous larger renogy panels I ordered but beyond that they are working great. I mounted them on a cargo trailer and so far they have survived a couple thousand miles of towing. They also allowed me to pull more current from the batteries without a voltage drop that I experienced previously with only 2 panels. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Williams

customer_reviews.title: easy durable power
customer_reviews.text: Needed a standby power source for my solar water heater. Wanted to drive a 100 watt circulation pump. Not considering conversion losses, thought this might fill the bill. Did work, but fell short on total power needed. So ordered another and together they provide a reliable driver for the circulation system. Total observed load runs about 132 watts. My inverter is older 200 watts and could be more efficient, it gets quite warm when running all day. Still safe however. Units are light enough to put onto operation as needed, then stored out of the weather to prolong life.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Sindel

customer_reviews.title: Been working great
customer_reviews.text: Happy with them so far. It should be cheaper to buy a bulk / multi pack but for some very odd reason it's more expensive. I bought 2 a year ago and just got 4 more. I ordered the single panel and just put in my quantity as 2 (first order) and 4 for my newest order. Got this newest order when they hit the lowest price I've seen. $90.67 each. The 2+ packages / multi packs cost more but buying 1 and changing the quantity to whatever you want, you get the single (cheaper) price. Shipped UPS which I do not like but was free to Alaska.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, I love this!  Its my electrical back-up plan in an event of a black-out!
customer_reviews.text: Special shout-out to the YouTuber HOBOTECH who advised me on this solar panel purchase! Plus the YouTuber have lots of videos to show people about these panels and portable power systems. I am so thankful that this kind of help is out there for clueless people like myself when it comes to solar panels and portable power systems! This is my first solar panel ever and now I am ready if there is ever a power blackout in my area! My purchase of a solar panel works very well that I can actually use it for my regular power too!
customer_reviews.author: Malka Val

customer_reviews.title: I liked the quality and thought it was time to move ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered because of the sale, I have 20 and 30 watt versions from this company as well. I liked the quality and thought it was time to move up. Decided to mount one of these on my boat as I was planning on making a shade area any ways why not go full solar with my 40lb thrust motor. The panel survived a 4 foot fall onto aluminum boat deck. The performance is phenominal joined with a MPPT controller. I want to add another panel asap. (Don't we all)
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect description/specs!
customer_reviews.text: The actual panel specs do not match the website description. Normally this wouldn't be a big deal but I bought the panel specifically to match a panel I already own. Wiring different voltage/spec panels together is not ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Bressler

customer_reviews.title: Great Solar Panels for the money
customer_reviews.text: These are the first solar panels I have ever used so I have nothing to compare against, but I bought two 100W panels and I got 186W peak power out of my inverter at one point. I had the panels angled directly at the sun, but with inverter loss tagged on, I figured I would get closer to 160W. As for durability, they both fell face first onto a cinder block because I'm clumsy, and both survived with hardly a scratch. Very impressed with these panels.
customer_reviews.author: Collin T.

customer_reviews.title: Good panel, good output, sturdy constrution
customer_reviews.text: These panels are exactly as expected.. good output, well built.. I bought two to make a small parallel array and they work well together with the proper MC4 Y connectors and extension cables. The built in wires are short but just long enough to chain together if you are going in series.
customer_reviews.author: DigitalSorceress

customer_reviews.title: Well built and great tech support
customer_reviews.text: Well built product. Arrived in good condition. Very simple to hookup. I have four 100 watt mono panels. I have four 215 AH six volt batteries and they took my batteries from 80% to 100% in about two hours. Very pleased with purchase, one of the best things about Renogy besides a well built product is their tech support is Awesome, very helpful and fast responses. Buy Renogy you will be glad you did. #AdventureUninterrupted
customer_reviews.author: Sokcap48

customer_reviews.title: Third Purchase of this Panel
customer_reviews.text: We have a small 22ft RV. Ran out of room on the roof so this last pair is to accommodate when we park in the shade. Very good price. Work as soon as they are plugged together. Great panels.
customer_reviews.author: JanJohnson

customer_reviews.title: I love solar.
customer_reviews.text: I think I have had these for a year now, and yeah solar is pretty awesome. I am not an expert so I'm not gonna comment much, but from my experience solar is a no brainer. They are relatively cheap, sturdy, they do what they say they are gonna do. Shipping was nice, they are easy to set up. I so far have 2 and once I get my camper completed I am gonna buy 2 more for 400 watts. Even with 200 watts though it's been great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and no hassle!
customer_reviews.text: Recharges my deep cycle battery every day. I have a small toy hauler and replaced all incandescent bulbs with LED bulbs and it lasts me all day and all night with the heater running with refrigerator constantly on with just one 100 w panel. Excellent value and no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: El Grande

customer_reviews.title: Good cells but not the more expensive option
customer_reviews.text: I used to recommend these to anyone who was looking at solar but between the always not making sense pricing on multiple panels. They cost more each to buy 2 or 3 or 4 packs than they cost just to buy one. They are now $30 more than the other 100w panels on amazon. Time for them to take a look at their pricing method. They also charge more for kits than the individual parts cost.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Supplies Plenty of Power
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Solar Panel fits great on my barn style roof. This single panel keeps both my batteries charged. Even on cloudy days it will still produces enough to keep the batteries up. Its very durable and mounting was so easy. The quick connects made it easy for me to tap into my old system. By replacing the old flex panels it made the system so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Pops

customer_reviews.title: works for me
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these panels and they work great, even on a cloudy day. I use them in an Amateur Radio application where they charge my backup batteries and I've even used them during a contest while running off them and the batteries. I plan on adding a couple more to my setup.
customer_reviews.author: Ken K.

customer_reviews.title: Beware, no mounting brackets
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of the panels to add on to an existing solar panel system. They did not come with mounting brackets. I did not find this out until I drove 80 miles to our cabin to install them. Last 2 kits I got had them. Called customer support. They would not do anything to help me. Had to order brackets separately. The prices on the panels also went down 12 dollars each right after I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Morrill

customer_reviews.title: Ill fitting connector
customer_reviews.text: The positive MC4 connector is too large and I had a terrible time getting it to connect to the extension cable. So much so that I don't think I will ever get it off without some damage if I want to increase the cable later.
customer_reviews.author: Muffin

customer_reviews.title: They’re amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Renogy solar panels. I bought a 100 watt kit to begin with. I used it for months. And then I realized that I need a little more. So I bought one more 100 watt to make 200 watt system. It is just the right amount for what I need. Just the thought of having the sun give you your energy to have cold food, heat do your not cold and lights to keep you out of the dark. I’m so very happy that I bought these!! Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: montanales

customer_reviews.title: Great solar panel, built strong
customer_reviews.text: I really love these I have now only 2 of them on my roof, wish I could afford more. I use them to power up anything that is 12v. I don't have much luck with AC inverters as they use too much power, when you use the battery and solar as the 12v DC you will get much more use out of the energy. Great company and Great panels.
customer_reviews.author: Gina McGlothin

customer_reviews.title: Remove Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: The Renogy 12v 100w solar panel is a very high quality product. This company is my goto place for diy solar equipment. I put 4 of these in my 2000 Cavco park model and connected them to a Maxoak Bluetti li 1.5 kw battery. The 4 panel setup did create an input voltage overload problem in the battery but it runs fine with 3 panels. Nice to have energy security backup plus run my 10cu ft energy star fridge and be able to charge various devices plus keep the lights on.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've had these two 100w panels for about a week... (temporarily connected to the renogy charge controller that was previously purchased)... they did a great job of charging the t105 Trojans in my diy portable solar generator. Yeah, I know t105's in a solar generator is a bit heavy, but dang I've got the ah.. I'll be purchasing more of these renogy panels for a larger system soon.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Gave it 4 stars cause my KIT had wire marked + / - this did not?
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be constructed well. Almost ready to try them out. But really without my other KIT I bought I would have never known what wire was + and what one was negative??
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Just awesome. My first attempt to go a little green
customer_reviews.text: This is my second 100w solar panel that I am using to power my 26 - 12v led 3 watt night lights in my back yard. The extra panel is being used with the existing panel I purchased along with the controller to charge a 75AH deep cycle battery. I run the lights at least 3hrs a night. Just awesome. My first attempt to go a little green. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Cushing

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and excellent product A++
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and quality made, I would recommend to anyone! Easy setup for a beginner or a professional, which I'm in the middle of both of those 2. I bought 1 and then another because the solar panel worked better than expected got number 2 panel and also worked better than expected so I would recommend and I would be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Shattered glasses on the panel
customer_reviews.text: The package came in with a torn up box and the panel glasses were all shattered in pieces. I actually cut myself when it pull it out of the box....so disappointed. I was looking forward to this
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Solid!
customer_reviews.text: I put this panel on some bedbars on the truck bed. I had it mounted when I went on a trip through Death Valley and it held up great. Have taken it on multiple offroad trips and it still works great. Will be buying more Renogy products for my trailer in the future. I have it connected to a battery and it keeps it fully charged ready to use for the night ! Didn’t know Renogy had a new one out with black trims but I painted mine black and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Ovo5.7

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these & power 4 100AH batteries. I use on a work site running a 3000W inverter, miter saws, table saw& compressor. It gives power all day & only loses about 25% of battery over a whole day! Good panels
customer_reviews.author: Jan Tonkin

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I now have six of these and am producing lots of power. They are easy to wire and easy to mount. I have them mounted on the top of my motorhome and have not run out of power yet!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Brown

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Very good, charges my batteries while im at work using a different charge controler. Even built a jig for it. Update 1-19-19 Purchased a second one and put it next to the first one. Crazy winds blew it from its frame and it landed face first on a pile of bricks,i thought it was a gonner. Other than a small scratch, it was just fine so i put it back up more securely now im back to where i was. Im amazed just how sturdy these pannels are! I wouldnt get anything else but renogy, definitely worth the extra $15.
customer_reviews.author: Rajahalamas

customer_reviews.title: Mount on a stand .
customer_reviews.text: Running DC power ,in a cabin ,all led lighting ,4 Marine batteries , 4 100 watt panels ,all the power I need and more ,tv,phone and computer charging , cloudy snowy days ,4 days a week on average , haven't run a generator since I brought the system up to 4 panels in January !
customer_reviews.author: dennis stevens

customer_reviews.title: Survived a hail storm (quarter size) facing straight up.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 5 panels over the last few years. This year we had a hail storm that destroyed our roof but the panels came out fine! You will never get the full 100 watts per hour though. This is expected because I'm near DC way North of the equator and now it's going into winter.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas198467

customer_reviews.title: Not 100 watts but only 52 under correct sun.
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly. Packed well. But it isn't 100 watts as it clams ...* At 2 pm* under full California sun it makes only 52 watts . So, it is why 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Armen

customer_reviews.title: Solid Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a first impression based on about a week of operation. The panels are very well packaged using thick foam, little risk of damage. The panels have a nice aluminum frame and look well made. I believe the units are made in Thailand for Renogy but there is no branding. I used the Renogy rails to install the units - I would recommend the rails as it minimizes the number of holes drilled/sealed into the roof and allows for quick removal. Each unit comes with a nice spec sheet.
customer_reviews.author: debushau

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - Work Great
customer_reviews.text: The one was not enough to generate power for an overcast day. The three together generated 150W instead of 300W as rated. My only complaint on these two additional ones is the lack of brackets, that were included in the single starter set.
customer_reviews.author: k2

customer_reviews.title: Great panel and brand
customer_reviews.text: We have installed this panel on our cargo trailer. It supplies a charge for either the trailer battery or the car battery of then vehicle we carry inside. Works great and we are happy with the install. Great price for such a well made panel.
customer_reviews.author: Matt from SD

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend even for daily use.
customer_reviews.text: It generates power as expected! This panel is definitely a must have for tiny house living or an emergency power backup. I've been running a CF-30 using power generated from one of these panels for the last 3 months flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Ray K

customer_reviews.title: Van Build Essential
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of those, and for the price it might be the best source of power you can find! I can supply my van for days (also with Renogy batteries), and they can fit the roof of a van. I really appreciated Renogy support online and found all the answers to my questions ;)
customer_reviews.author: PruneAndLeo

customer_reviews.title: Great solar panels! Great price!
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these solar panels now connected in parallel and their fantastic! Working great! I've got all three attached to wooden frame so that I can move them around towards the sun. Perfect addition to my off-grid tiny Homestead! I hope to get more of these in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Ann's Tiny Life

customer_reviews.title: Malfunction
customer_reviews.text: Panel failed on first usage. Worked fine for 4 days. Failed on the 5th day. No longer produced adequate voltage to maintain battery.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Installed 2 -100 watts panels on top my camper van with brackets and Butyl tape. Hooked up to my 100 amp hour lithium battery, and keeps my battery charged very well all day. happy with the great price compared to others and, I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: GO SOLAR
customer_reviews.text: I've got four of these now, I will get more as soon as I can. I really get a thrill out of producing my own electricity. I have a very small system but I have all the power I need in my garage. Along with my Go power 1500 watt pure sine wave inverter, I operate lights, all sorts of power tools. With power to spare. I really can't think of enough good things to say about these panel's and homebrewed electric power. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sissy

customer_reviews.title: ... I can say and this is for real I love it love it love it worked awesome easy as ...
customer_reviews.text: All I can say and this is for real I love it love it love it worked awesome easy as 123 to set up and worked in my living room on a semi sunny day I'd buy my Renogy solar panel again I'm very happy #AdvetureUninterrupted
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I liked them so much I ended up buying eight of them. I'm an enthusiast that does not require solar power but I do like running things without line power.
customer_reviews.author: William Viands

customer_reviews.title: I have been extremely satisfied with these solar panels
customer_reviews.text: I have been extremely satisfied with these solar panels. I have two of them that I use to charge batteries at my solar powered VHF radio repeater site. They seem to hold up well and perform even better. We modified the mounting brackets and drilled some of our own holes to fit our application and it worked out very well. The panel feels sturdy and I think it is well built. I have not had any problems with the solar panels.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon McKinney

customer_reviews.title: All great products here 👌🏽
customer_reviews.text: Got this panel in less than 2 days with standard shipping. Looks great, connects easily, well made. Great product, very happy. For our #vanlife adventure van! Renogy seems like a solid company, ordered the branch connectors as well and they arrived same day, within 8 hours!! Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: surfinglifebk

customer_reviews.title: I tested with a meter at noon, 03/04/2017, ...
customer_reviews.text: I tested with a meter at noon, 03/04/2017, Arizona, mostly clear, intermittent clouds, measured 21 volts output at the unite wires.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bintz

customer_reviews.title: perfect solar panels for my garage
customer_reviews.text: very good panels. producing around 19v each panels. packing is solid none are broken I ordered 16 units all good. best bang for the buck panels on Amazon .
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: A++ on quality.  No brainer.  I plan to buy more.
customer_reviews.text: Quality is top notch! I bought a second. Put this item in your wish list. I got an email it went on sale and I bought it for 99 dollars. I would say more about this product but it's just a solar panel and once you see it you will know with in 2 seconds that it is very well made and great quality. I plan on buying about 4 more when I see a sale.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Renogy products are great!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure if 100 watts would be enough to recharge my two deep cell travel trailer batteries after a night of heater and lights use. So far, the system (Renogy controller) is working great. Recharges the batteries for the next nights use. Lightweight and well made product. Weighs less then my Harbor Freight 15w unit if about the same size.
customer_reviews.author: alan b

customer_reviews.title: Awesome solar panel for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome solar panel for the price.. I use this and a Yeti 400 from Goal Zero to provide power for me on my climbing / car camping trips. And its great.. Its too unwieldy to hike in with.. but if you are car camping or operating from a base camp it is great!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Pry

customer_reviews.title: Good panels so far
customer_reviews.text: Work well and are well made. I have not had a hail storm yet but it is only a matter of time and I will update later. I get 70 watts per panel in winter and my angle is for spring/fall so it seems 70 is a minimum on a sunny day.
customer_reviews.author: jmoonx14Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Renogy customer service, non existent.
customer_reviews.text: I do like the panels, but I had a terminal cover just fell off of the back of one plastic clip broke, After being put on hold 30 min finally reached Renogy customer service, I sent pictures of defective cover they said they would send me another, never received it, emailed Amazon about my problem, they reimbursed me for panel, Amazon has the best customer service ever, Renogy not do much.
customer_reviews.author: dadsblue71

customer_reviews.title: Better Quality Solar Panel
customer_reviews.text: I use two panels on the RV roof. The panels feel sturdier than other 100 watt panels I have used in the past. I feel safe mounting onto the roof and driving down the highway.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Cox

customer_reviews.title: Well built. Works as advertised. I have four ...
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Works as advertised. I have four setups with these connected to morningstar sunsaver 12v 10A pwm charge controllers, and they keep the 2 batteries on four separate camper trailers topped off for the past 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Magilla

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I have now used it for camping twice with a battery bank. I plan to build a real solar grid with this and several other panels, likely the same as this. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: Very fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Got two 2-packs. Ordered on Wednesday and they were delivered on Thursday. Amazoning! Panels are easy to install and appear to provide rated output. Nice to have five year / 25 year warranty. Should outlast my application.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K.

customer_reviews.title: Wire them correctly.
customer_reviews.text: I had them wired up wrong and was pulling 8 amps max with 400 watts of panels. Then I wired them in parallel and went from getting 5 amps on a cloudy day to 22 amps! Since the re wiring they are charging my battery much quicker. About to order two more
customer_reviews.author: Stanton Moor

customer_reviews.title: not the cheapest
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and their very sturdy. they seem well built. tech support was nonexistent though. pretty easy to install. just the value wasn’t there. after i bought i saw other same 100 watt panels for cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: E. Wu

customer_reviews.title: Good quality 12 volt mono solar panels, great for smaller applications.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice good quality 12 volt panels that tested out well. These are nice mono panel and great for small size panels. You can more easily transport these due to the smaller size. They would be great with a smaller application or can also be wired into larger configurations if you want to use them that way. However the cost would add up over just going with larger panels at that point. Overall the quality is good, fast shipping, and met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: W. P. Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: These seem like nice solid panels.
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be good panels. I don't think I ever get the full 100 watts. Most of the day I get far less because I never get perfect full sunlight at the perfect angle. It's not the fault of the panel but keep that in mind when planning how many panels you need.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Second Renogy panel. First one I've had for years, no complaints. Go Renogy go
customer_reviews.author: Michael

product_meta.title: Renogy Solar Panel, Single
product_meta.description: Size:Single Panel| Style:Solar PanelRenogy 100W 12V monocrystalline solar Panel is Renogy most popular product! High in power but sleek in size, This 100W solar panel is the perfect item for off-grid applications. Use it for your RV when camping, or during beach trips with the family, either way this monocrystalline panel provides you with the most efficiency per space. With a set of MC4 connectors coming directly off the panel, connecting with other Renogy panels is a breeze. If off-grid solar interests you, then start with Renogy today!
feature_bullets: TECHNOLOGY - Advanced encapsulation material with multi-layered sheet minimizations enhance cell performance and provide a longer service life. Corrosion-resistant aluminum frame allows extended outdoor use; the panels can last for decades, anti-reflective, high transparency, low iron-tempered glass. No hot-spot heating .
Usages - high in power but compact in size, this 100-watt Solar panel is a favorite for RVs, boats, campers and similar applications, providing clean energy and excellent efficiency per space.

Installation - pre-drilled holes on the back of the panel allow for fast mounting and securing. Pre-drilled holes included for grounding. Compatible with different Renogy mounting systems such as z-brackets, pole mounts and tilt mounts.
Dimensions - each panel weighs 16. 5lbs. length 47. 0" X width 21. 3" X Height 1. 4”. IP67 Rated waterproof MC4 connectors
25-year transferable power output ; 5-year material and workmanship
Guaranteed positive output tolerance (0-3%); withstands high winds (2400Pa) and snow loads (5400Pa)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,624 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
